title: 820-3332 running hot -dark probe points
message:
This machine runs great except customer complains it runs very hot. so what was noticable - battery reports replace soon as well as running real hot.
So i run asd and it is throwing some memory errors, but still runs fine.

i removed board and upon inspecting found that most probe points are black - very darkened? what causes this? they are not corroded - as soon as i scratch they come up super shiny. Also there is a rubber sticker on u8900. is this something apple places to fix there crappy solder joints?

thanks

title: 820-3332 running hot -dark probe points
message: i just ran flir over the machine it nothing looks out of the ordinary. max temps i can see 60c on u1800 should i still run hwmonitor for temps?

title: 820-3332 running hot -dark probe points
message:
Did you also note it runing hot, or just the client complains that?
Run Heaven test and see is something strange happens.
Reflow/change U8900, just in case.
HWMonitor can show you temps in real time, so give it a try...

title: 820-3332 running hot -dark probe points
message:
only complaint is from client.
i will test with heaven

thanks for the tips. i have been using tech tools pro. but definately try hwmonitor
